title: Government spending for SNAP benefits ( Food Stamps ) in the U.S. 1995 to 2020
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Spending in billion U.S. dollars, with a total of 6 data points. The chart has 2 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2015 to 1995.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2020 to 2015.
gold: The statistic shows total U.S. government spending for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP , formerly called Food Stamps ) from 1995 to 2020 . In 2010 , about 70 billion U.S. dollars were spent for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program .
